item.title: I/O and Secondary Storage
item.description: I/O Programmed I/O: CPU does all the work. 2 forms: Memory mapped I/O: I/O devices treated like memory, and sending / receiving data between them uses the same instructions as writing / reading to memory. Requires reserving memory space for I/O devices. Isolated I/O: Bus has seperate I/O read / write lines. Instructions specify whether an address is for I/O or main memory. Waiting for I/O devices to be ready takes a long time.
